lexUnit.name: follow.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: come after in time or order.

sentence.text: The decision followed the freeing of a man who killed his mother-in-law .
The deep recession that followed shows how painful true perestroika can be .
A very basic synopsis of the play follows in order to contextualise the analysis .
A whole series of measures followed promoting the position of radicals -- and the Communists -- at the expense of the moderates .

The appeal followed a meeting to discuss the case of 11-year-old Gemma left alone in a flat in Hammersmith , west London .
The Pact would provide for the withdrawal of Soviet forces following the formation of a coalition government in Kabul .

This controversy was immediately followed by another .

The relative stability in the north that followed Barbarossa 's defeat set the stage for the next step in the rise of the city states .

Spikes of succulent red berries follow in the autumn .
The Treasury now expects a fall of 1% in non-oil GDP in 1992 , followed by growth of 1% in 1993 : the average GDP growth in 1993 forecast by independents is 1 1 / 2 % .
